turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Can't.  History report.  The Normans and the Saxons.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Bogutude.  Blow it off.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: I really can't.  Besides, it's pretty interesting.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: You're weird and I'm afraid of you. Seriously, Cassandra, there's a lot cooler things you could be doing than your homework.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Like my homework.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Guys, what's the sitch?  I'm bored.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: ) What do you think?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Please.  It's so '91.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: What are we doing?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Why don't we see a movie?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Well, where?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Beverly Center.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Please.  They show previews for foreign movies.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Totally stale.  And the ushers are like, the acne patrol.  We're thinking Pavilion.  Sitch?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Sounds toasty.  We're going Pavilion.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Excuse much!  Not rude or anything.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Nice ensemble!

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: What did Jeffrey's dad say?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: 'Just remember you're in training, son'

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Let's meet tonight, okay?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Cafe Blase.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I don't see why we have to invite everyone.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Kimberly, it's the senior dance.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I didn't learn... I just... it's not a big deal.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Buffy, I'm gonna tell Jeffrey you were playing with another man's Hebrew National.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Get a boob job.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: You were supposed to be here at three.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I forgot.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Buffy, what is your sitch?  You're acting like The Thing From Another Tax-Bracket; it's too weird.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Look, a lot's been going on.  That's what I wanted to tell you guys about. I need to tell you.  You see... a while ago, I met this guy --

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Oh my God you're having an affair.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Excuse me for having something important to do.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: This isn't important?  The earth is our home.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Kimberly, it's a dance.  It's a stupid dance with a bunch of stupid kids that I see every stupid day.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Listen to you.  What language are you speaking?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Get out of my facial.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I'm glad you guys are here.  It's good to see you.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Yeah, whoops I came.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: You look way pretty, Kim.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I know.  I like your little outfit.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: God, where the hell did you come from?  You scared me to death.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: I'm sorry.  That was impressive. The...  tumbling.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: What?  Oh.  I used to do gymnastics. Are you looking for someone?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: I'm looking for you, actually.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Am I in trouble or something?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Not at all.  My name is Merrick.  I was sent to find you some time ago. I should have found you much sooner but there were...  complications. You should have been taught, prepared.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: I've searched the entire world for you, Buffy.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: To bring you... your birthright.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: My birthright?  You mean, like a trust fund?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I had a trust fund my great- grandfather, or maybe it was an inheritance, 'cause he's dead, and I spent it on shoes.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: You must come with me.  It's much too late already.  You must come with me to the graveyard.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Wait a minute.  My birthright is in the graveyard?  Later not.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Wait!

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: You're one of those skanky old men that, like, attack girls and stuff. Forget you.  My, um, my boyfriend is gonna be here in about thirty seconds, and he's way testy.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: You don't understand.  You have been chosen.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Chosen to go to the graveyard?  Why don't you just take the first runner up, okay?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: You must believe me.  You must come with me while there's still time.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Time to do what?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: To stop the killing.  To stop the vampires.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Let me get this straight.  You're like, this greasy bum, and I have to go to the graveyard with you 'cause I'm chosen, and there's vampires.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Does Elvis talk to you?  Tell you to do things?  Do you see spots?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: I don't have time for your prattling. I have proof.  You bear the mark.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Just stay away from me, okay?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Did you ever dream that you were someone else?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Everybody does.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: In the past.  A girl.  Maybe... A Magyar peasant.  An Indian princess. A slave.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I was a slave.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: In Virginia.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I don't know.  It was...  There was a big gram or something.  And there's one, I'm like a prostitute...

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: China.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Oh, my God.  I never told anybody about this.  I remember the one about the peasant, too.  God, there's a bunch.  Is this, like channeling or something.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I had a dream once where I was... There was like, knights in it, and I worked in this bar.  And I... was fighting.  I'm always fighting. And there's a guy...  He's not always there, but he's horrible, all white, and he's always... trying to kill me.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Lothos.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: How do you know all this?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: I have to show you.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I can't believe I'm doing this.  I can't believe I'm in a graveyard with a strange man hunting for vampires on a school night.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Why didn't you ever tell anybody about your dreams?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Oh, yeah, tell everyone I'm crazy. Beauty ida.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Ow.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Cramps?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: None of your business.  God.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: This is it.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Wait a minute.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Just for protection.  You won't have to do anything.  I just need you to watch.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: All right.  What do we do now?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: We wait for Robert to wake up.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Where's the other one?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: She --

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Go to school tomorrow.  Try to act normal.  Don't let anyone know what's happening.  This is important. When the vampires find out who you are... you won't be hunting them anymore.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Meet me at this address after school.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I have cheerleading squad.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Skip it.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: They can't come in, right?  Unless you invite them.  Is that true?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: It's true.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: It's not pretty, but it does suit our purposes.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Our purposes.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: What, um...  What do we do?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: There's a great deal I have to show you, I'm not even sure where to start  There's so little time.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Why do you keep saying that?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Do you know what a Vampire-King is?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: A Vampire-King?  You mean like Dracula?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Oh, yes.  And the man from your dreams.  Lothos.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Oh, him.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Yes.  They travel about, usually with one or two of their followers to lay the groundwork.  The vampires find a community and they feed on it, make it their own.  You were difficult to trace, and I think the process has gone a lot further than I'd anticipated.  Usually this goads a community into some kind of paranoid frenzy.  But for some reason, nobody here seems to be paying any attention.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: We'll cover it later.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I still don't get how they happened to come to my town.  I mean, was I born here because... because they were coming here?  That Lothos guy, and his buddies?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: In a way, yes.  Your fate is inexorably connected to them.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Great.  First I have a birthright, now I've got a fate.  Hey, do I have to take notes on this?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: We're going to have the work hard. You'll need some excuse for staying out.  For your parents.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Not a pressing issue.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: I tell you, the best thing I can do right now is find out more about you.  What your strengths are, your likes...  Everything.  What's your best subject?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Uh... gym.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Yes, you used to do gymnastics. But you stopped.  Why?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Well, everybody says... it's just kind of dorky.  I mean, have you ever seen a gymnast's legs?  They're like --  -- the mighty oak.  It's not a look.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: But you enjoyed it, yes?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Well... I do cheerleading now. It's way cooler.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Cheerleading.  For... sporting events, yes?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Sporting events, yeah.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: All right.  Why don't you show me a cheer?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Here?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Yes, yes.  It would be interesting. A nice cheer.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Who we gonna beat?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Who we gonna beat?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: No -- you don't have to --

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Oh.  I thought... you lead me --

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: No.  You don't do anything.  I do it.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Oh.  Good.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Oh, what the hell is wrong with you?  You threw a knife at my head!

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: I had to test you.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: But you threw a knife at my head!

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: And you caught it!  Only the chosen one could have done that.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I don't want to be the chosen one, okay?  I don't want to spend the rest of my life chasing after vampires!  I just want to graduate from high school, go to Europe, marry Charlie Sheen and die.  It may not sound too exciting to a sconehead like you, but I think it's swell.  And then you come along...  and... and then I'm a member of the hairy mole club, so you throw things at me!

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: It was necessary.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Last night.  You knew I was sitting on a fresh grave, didn't you?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: I don't think you understand the full implications of --

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Oh.  Sorry.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Don't you see what's happening? You're changing.  You've got powers you've only just begun to tap. Physical, mental prowess you've never dreamed of.  God, this hurts.  I've administered a few shocks to your system to start the adrenaline working.  I'm sorry I have to take so many shortcuts in the training process.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Put your head back.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Two days ago, would you have even hit me?  Let alone so powerfully?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: No... I guess I would have gotten Jeffrey to hit you.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Exactly.  You're changing.  You're becoming something extraordinarily powerful.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Ooh, another embarrassment for the teabag, while the chosen one is still well under par.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Your turn.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: What about bats?  Do they turn into bats?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: No.  No bats, no flying.  They... float, occasionally.  Not really flying.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Toasty.  Were there ever any, like, famous vampires?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Oh, several.  Lucretia Borgia, Joseph Mengele, Franklin Pangborn... are any of those names familiar?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: If I say 'no' does that make me a bad person?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Good Lord.  What do you study in history?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: My nails.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: All right.  You've heard of the emperor Caligula, perhaps?  Or Jack the Ripper?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: They were vampires?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Same one.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: What!?!

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Try to pay attention.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: He was slow.  Very simple.  They won't all be that easy.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: And the alley was a mistake.  Never corner yourself like that.  If they'd come at you in force you'd be dead now.  One vampire is a lot easier to kill then ten.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Does the world 'Duhh' mean anything to you?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: You felt a little sick, didn't you? The cramps.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Nice conversationalist!  Yeah, I felt 'em a little, but I ain't due for two weeks since you're so excited about the subject.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: It's natural.  A reaction to their presence, to the... unnaturalness of it.  It's part of how you are able to track them.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Oh, wonderful.  My secret weapon is - PMS.  That's just great.  Thanks for telling me.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: You'll get used to it.  I'm more worried about your tactical mistakes.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: You are such a wet.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: A what?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: A wet!  Didn't I just kill that vampire?  I think I did.  I didn't see you killing any vampires.  You were too busy playing 'Beat the Clock'.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Don't start with me again.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Aren't I, like the chosen one?  The one and only?  The Grand High Poobah and doesn't that mean you have to be nice to me?  Like, ever?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Buffy...

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: And why are you always wearing black? It's so down.  It's totally not your color.  I don't think you have a color.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: What do you want?  Encouragement?  'Gosh, Buffy, you're so special, I just want to give you a great big hug, oh I'm just having a warm fuzzy.'

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Oh, fuck you!

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Do you know how many girls I've trained to be Slayers?  Five.  Five properly prepared girls, girls who faced their responsibilities, who worked hard to become women overnight -- harder than you've ever worked in your life -- and I saw them ripped apart.  Do you want to live?  Do you?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: What did you think, that being able to jump about and hit people makes you a Slayer?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Five?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Five.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: So, basically, I've got the life expectancy of a zit, right?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Not if you're careful.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: How can you keep doing this?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: It's what I was raised to do.  There aren't many of us left, the Watchers.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Watchers?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: There's a small village in Hampshire, near Stonehenge...  ... near a bunch of big rocks. That's where I was born.  My father taught me about the training, about finding the Slayers, reading the signs.  There's a small cluster of us, a few families, really... most of the neighboring villagers think we're just a bunch of harmless old loonies.  I thought so myself for a time, when I was younger...  I'm sorry.  I'm not supposed to... I shouldn't go on like this.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I wish you would.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: It isn't important.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I'm curious, is all.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Buffy, don't... don't start thinking of me as your friend.  It interferes with the work, and it...

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: And it makes it worse when I die, right?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Well, you know, I'm not gonna kick so easy.  I've got a few things the other girls didn't have.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: As for example, what?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Well... there's my keen fashion sense, for one.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Vampires of the world, beware.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Merrick.  You made a joke.  Are you okay, I mean, do you want to lie down?  I know it hurts the first time.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I mean, most of the time Jeffrey's really sweet, but sometimes he gets kind of... 'Me-Tarzan'ish, you know what I mean?  Lately it bugs me, I guess.  Merrick?  Are you still breathing?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: I can't work this.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: We call them zippers.  They're not supposed to be a challenge.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: But it's in the back.  Why are we wasting time with this, anyway?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Because you clash, Merrick.  You clash with everything.  I mean you might as well go around with a sign, 'Slayers trained her.'  Honestly, you look like something out of... Pasadena.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: My clothes have always been perfectly serviceable.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Well, you're on my turf now.  You're just gonna have to trust me.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: I want to die.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Okay.  The important thing is not to panic.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Interesting.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I kind of had to improvise.  Sorry about your guitar.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: There isn't time.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Make time, okay?  You're the one who told me to act normal.  I've missed three practices already.  If I'm not there for the Barber game tomorrow everyone's gonna talk.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Another distraction.  It's not right.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Why because it's not my fate?  It's not in the Book-of-All- Knowledgefullness that I'm gonna be cheerleading at the Barber game?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Sooner or later you're going to have to accept it.  Your fate.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I'm pretty much learning not to accept anything anymore.  Come on, Merrick.  Football.  Afterwards we can kill and kill until there is nothing left.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Toasty.  You should come; it's gonna be a great game.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Oh, I'll be there all right.  I'm not letting you out of my sight. Not till you're ready.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Try and be inconspicuous, okay? Act like a fan.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Football is my life.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: You're learning.  Slowly, incredibly slowly, but you're learning.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: None of the other girls ever gave me this much trouble.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: And where are they now?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Wait!

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: He knows who I am!

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Mr. Howard is so heinous.  He's always giving me a hard time.  I get a C-plus on the test and he tells me, 'You have no sense of history.'  I have no sense of history?  He wears a brown tie.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: You got a C-plus?  I can't believe I cheated off you.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Excuse me for not knowing about El Salvador.  Like I'm ever going to Spain anyway.  Ooh!

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: No THX.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: They don't even have Dolby.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: So, is Jeffrey really spending the night at your house?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: That's the plan.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Good enough!

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Cool.  We can figure decorations and stuff.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Cassandra, you gotta come, too.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Come one, that was so weird.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: What, it's not weird.  I just cut the stupid hot dog in half.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: -- like she's gonna kill me.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I was just scared is all.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: No.  It was mondo bizarro.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: That is so cool.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Thank you very much.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Nobody is even gonna look at the game.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: I don't get it.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: How do you not tread on the earth? I mean, you kind of have to.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: You guys blow.  I'm waiting on Cassandra.  She's gonna help me with my history.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Cassandra's really smart.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Yeah... She's okay, though.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: I guess.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Don't worry, Jennifer.  Someday your prince will come.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Yeah, just make sure you do first. Let's go, guys.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: B'bye.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Hey, Buffers.  You look thrashed.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: You and Cassandra get anything done last night?

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Buffy, Jesus!  You know these steps.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Pike.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: You're having a fling with him?

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Well, I guess you got what you came for.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Nicole...

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Later for it.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Hi, guys.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Have you guys seen Jeffrey?  The limo never showed, I thought he might be here.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: I haven't seen him tonight.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: LOTHOS
turns.text: I find it restorative, sleeping in the life-blood of so many.  To feel their souls coursing about me.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: What's happening?  What do you want?

turns.speaker: LOTHOS
turns.text: So very much.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: My parents have money...

turns.speaker: LOTHOS
turns.text: Yes, I'm sure they do.  This place is everything you said it was, Amilyn.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: What... are you?

turns.speaker: LOTHOS
turns.text: Are we so strange?  So alien to you?  I've seen this culture, the wealth, the greed, the waste... it's truly heartwarming.  The perfect place to spread my empire.  Honestly, Eastern Europe was so dead, the Communists just drained the blood out of the place.  It's livened up a bit in the past few years, but it's nothing compared to this.... this Mecca of consumption.  The city of Angels.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: No, wait.  I can be dumb.  Really. Or mean, or whatever.  I can learn. I'm useful.

turns.speaker: LOTHOS
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Swear to God.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: I can't!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: You know you must.  There is only one.  Now you are that one.  It is time.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: Why?  Why me?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: She has died.  You are the next to be called.  Why do you think you were sent to me?  Trained as you were?  You bear the mark.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: The mark of the Coven.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Ever since Adam and Eve first left the garden, he followed: the serpent. Satan.  He sends his legion in the shape of men, to feed on us, to breed his Hell on our earth.  They are a plague upon us.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: But as long as there have been vampire, there has been the Coven; the line of Slayers.  Ones with the strength and the skill to kill them, to find them where they gather and stop the swell of their numbers. One dies, the next is called.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: I'm just a girl.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: You are much more.

turns.speaker: GRUELLER
turns.text: Bessel!  What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: Hi, Grueller.

turns.speaker: GRUELLER
turns.text: What are you grinning at?  You think I was scared?

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: Could be.

turns.speaker: GRUELLER
turns.text: You think so?

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: Could be.

turns.speaker: GRUELLER
turns.text: Listen, you little worm.  I could beat your head to a pulp for you, just like I did last year, you got that?  You got that?

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: Got that.

turns.speaker: GRUELLER
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Write that down.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Okay, what else?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Oh, yes!  Yes!

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Oh, baby!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Make me a woman!  Yes!  Make me a woman!

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Buffy?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Jeffrey!

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Well, I'm done.  Are you done?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: No --

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Okay, let's go.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: But --

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: She didn't even hardly talk to anyone in school.  All year.  She didn't even go to the prom.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I heard she got straight A's.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I can't believe they still ate it.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Where'd you learn how to do that?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: So they found Cassandra's body out by the railway tunnels.  Nobody's saying anything, but they think she was involved in something, like, illegal or something.  Like dealing.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Well, I hope so.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Probably was.  What do you suppose she was doing out there.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I got all the plastic stuff.  What should I do with it?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Throw it out.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: And Spring Fling.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: She was even crazier after that.  I mean it, you wouldn't even have recognized her.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Buffy?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Omniplex?

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Nee sitch.  No way.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Buffy was on the uneven parallels -- she was really good; coach said she could have been in the Olympics -- but she was doing a routine, spinning, and the beam broke.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You're kidding.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Snapped.  Buffy was, you know, on the upswing, and I swear to God she went across the room.  Perm over heels.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Oh, my God!  Ouch!  No wonder you quit.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Well, that's the thing.  She landed on her feet.  Didn't even sprain a toe.  And I go up to her and she turns and looks at me and she's like this --

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I never thought of that.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: I gotta bail.  You coming?

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Buffy!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: What is she...

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Cool!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Does Jeffrey know?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: The don't.  You kind of wish they would, though.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Wit-tay.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I'm Pike.  This is Benny.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Pike isn't a name.  It's a fish.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Hey, wait a minute...

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: They'll kill us!

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: You want some punch?

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Oh, God.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: He is so bald.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: God!  Take a chill lozenge.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Like we don't have rights too?

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: The homelesses?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Oh, please.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Environment.  That's cool with me.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Oh, yeah!

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Right!

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: If we don't invite all the seniors we can't use the school funds, you know that.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Can't they make exceptions?  Maryanne Heinel?  She's such a scud.  Can't we have a Maryanne clause?

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Well, look who's here.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Smell of booze much.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Nice much.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Buffy, the ape-woman.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Seriously, Buffy.  That look was way twisted.  What were you thinking about?
